content: The "Internet Tax Freedom Act Amendments Act of 2007" changes the moratorium on internet taxes to extend until 2014. States that currently tax internet access are grandfathered in. The Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to define 'Internet access' for subsections (a) and (b) based on previous enactments. Exceptions apply until June 30, 2008, for taxes on Internet access related to telecommunications services. The Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to exempt taxes on Internet access related to telecommunications services until June 30, 2008, under specific conditions. The Internet Tax Freedom Act exempts taxes on Internet access telecommunications services until June 30, 2008, with specific conditions. No legislative inference can be drawn from this subsection or related amendments prior to June 30, 2008. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Section 1105 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to clarify the definition of Internet access services, including the purchase, use, or sale of telecommunications to enable users to connect to the Internet. The definition of Internet access services under the Internet Tax Freedom Act includes services like home pages, electronic mail, instant messaging, video clips, and personal electronic storage. It excludes voice, audio, or video programming, as well as other chargeable products or services that use Internet protocol. The definition of Internet access services under the Internet Tax Freedom Act includes services like home pages, electronic mail, instant messaging, video clips, and personal electronic storage. It excludes voice, audio, or video programming, as well as other chargeable products or services that use Internet protocol. The term 'telecommunications' is defined in accordance with the Communications Act of 1934 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internet Tax Freedom Act defines Internet access services to include various communication services but excludes certain types of taxes on commercial activities levied by states using specific terms like modified gross receipts or taxable margin. The Internet Tax Freedom Act sets criteria for taxes imposed on business activities, excluding discriminatory taxes on communication services, Internet access, or telecommunications. The Internet Tax Freedom Act allows states to modify covered taxes as long as they don't narrow the tax base significantly. No legislative inference can be made from this regarding taxes before November 1, 2007. SEC. 5 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act is amended to include telecommunications and enable access to internet content. Section 1108 is removed. SEC. 6 addresses the sunset of grandfather provisions. SEC. 6 of the Internet Tax Freedom Act addresses the sunset of grandfather provisions, stating that certain states are exempt if they have repealed taxes on Internet access more than 24 months prior to the enactment of this provision. SEC. 7 specifies that the Act and its amendments will take effect on November 1, 2007.
